alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 3:26AM CDT until further notice by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Pulaski. In southwest Missouri, Barry, Christian, Douglas, Laclede, Stone, Taney, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 326 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Bear Creek at Reno Springs Road, Little Beaver Creek at Old Cheese Plant Road, Bull Creek at Center Road, Beaver Creek at County Road 524 and Little Beaver Creek at County Road 447. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lebanon, Branson, Ava, Kimberling City, Forsyth, Highlandville, Hollister and Silver Dollar City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
